intro: Pseudolysimachion donetzicum, commonly known as the Donets Basin pseudolysimachion, is a rare flowering plant native to the Donets Basin region of Ukraine. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to the specific climatic conditions of its native habitat. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually purple or blue in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
